III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, one youth touched another youth sexually.
Another intake received 5/15/25: On 5/13/25 or 5/14/25, a youth
was inappropriately touched by another youth. Details are
unknown.
Investigation Interviews:
Law Enforcement was contact on May 19, 2025, via phone.
Law Enforcement gave permission for this consultant to
complete the licensing investigation without law
enforcement. They would reach out if there are any additional
needs.
Therapist was interviewed via phone on May 16, 2025.
Therapist reported she is not the primary therapist for Youth A and
Youth B. She reported she heard that Youth A made a complaint
about Youth B touching her inappropriately, but it was unknown
when or where this happened. Therapist reported Youth A likes to
attempt to be in relationships with other youth at the facility, and
when she gets upset with them, she will make claims against the
youth. She reported Youth A and Youth B have been moved to
separate wings of the building, so they have limited interactions
with one another. Therapist reported Youth A did talk to law
enforcement about this situation.
Attorney was interviewed via phone on May 16, 2025. Attorney
reported he works with Youth A and has been doing so for several
years. He reported visiting Youth A at the facility sometime last
week, and she had no complaints. Attorney reported he was
impressed with the staff as they were very attentive to the youth
and appeared to be fully staffed. He reported he received a call
from Youth A on May 14, 2025, stating that another youth at the
2

facility had touched her inappropriately, and it was not
consensual. Attorney reported Youth A did not disclose who this
youth was, where this happened, or if there were any witnesses.
He reported she did not give the exact date, but he believes it
could have occurred on May 13, 2025, or May 14, 2025, because
she has not reported this before, and they have constant
communication. Attorney reported he spoke with Foster Care
Worker who reported Youth A gave her a different story of what
happened. He reported he spoke with the facility on May 15, 2025,
and reported Youth A had spoken with Law Enforcement. Attorney
reported Youth A does want to move out of the facility and has a
history of manipulation.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on May 23,
2025. Foster Care Worker reported she spoke with Youth A about
this concern last week sometime. She reported Youth A reported
this occurred on May 13, 2025, or May 14, 2025, around 8:00pm
in the common area. Foster Care Worker reported Youth B had
touched Youth A’s breast under her shirt and that made her feel
uncomfortable. She reported Youth A did speak with law
enforcement about the situation, but they did not do anything.
Foster Care Worker reported the facility moved Youth B to another
part of the wing. She reported it is believed Youth A and Youth B
were dating at some point and maybe got upset with one another.
Foster Care Worker reported Youth A does have a history of
sexualized behaviors and has made allegations prior of people
touching her inappropriately.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Youth A reported she did not like being at the facility. She
reported she wanted to move and did not want to speak with this
licensing consultant. Youth A was asked about the reported
concerns she made to the police, and she stated she did not want
to talk about the situation. The interview ended as Youth A
attempted to AWOL from the unit.
Youth B was interviewed face to face the facility on May 27,
2025. Youth B reported she did not want to really talk to this
consultant. She denied ever touching Youth A and stated Youth A
just says these things to get attention. Youth B then ended the
interview with this consultant.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Staff 4 reported she had heard the concerns from Youth A
about Youth B touching her inappropriately. She reported Youth A
reported this occurred on May 13, 2025, or May 14, 2025, toward
3

the later part of the evening. Staff 4 reported Youth B also talked
with her about Youth A making false allegations against her just
because Youth B did not want to date her. She reported Youth A
and Youth B had been getting into verbal fights and was not
surprised that these allegations were made. Staff 4 reported Youth
A has a history of making up false stories. She does not have a
concern about this happening as she has never witnessed this
occur between Youth A and Youth B before.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on May 30, 2025. Staff 5
confirmed he was working on May 13, 2025 and May 14, 2025,
between the hours of 8:00pm and 9:00pm with Youth A and Youth
B. He denied ever seeing any concerns of Youth B touching Youth
A inappropriately. Staff 5 reported if he had seen something he
would have separated the youth and reported it immediately. He
reported he does remember Youth A and Youth B arguing with
one another on one of those days, but it was nothing
inappropriate.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
20, 2025. Supervisor reported she was present when Youth A
had called the police about the concern of Youth B touching her
inappropriately under her shirt. She reported law enforcement did
come to talk to Youth A. Supervisor reported due to the reported
allegations Youth B was moved to another wing immediately. She
reported there have been reported concerns to her from staff that
Youth A was trying to date Youth B, and they got into a verbal
argument over it. Supervisor reported Youth A likes to tell stories
to get attention. She reported Youth A has a hard time having
positive relationships with the other youth at the facility.
Supervisor reported there had been no reported concerns
between the two youth before these allegations.
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were separately interviewed face to
face at the facility on May 20, 2025. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3
reported they are aware of the current allegations as Youth A and
Youth B are in separate wings at the facility. They denied ever
seeing any inappropriate touching between the two youth. Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Staff 3 reported Youth A has a history of trying to date
youth at the facility and when the relationship does not go well
then Youth A will pick a fight or make a complaint. They reported
Youth A has a history of coming up with false stories. Staff 1, Staff
2, and Staff 3 did not have any concerns to note about the
supervision level of staff at the facility.
4

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 20,
2025. Youth C reported the facility has good staff supervision and
staff are always redirecting the youth to maintain appropriate
boundaries. She reported Youth A likes to tell a lot of stories to try
to make others feel bad for her. Youth C explained Youth A was
spreading a rumor Youth B had touched her inappropriately when
really Youth B turned down Youth A when she asked her to date
her. She reported Youth A is a bully at the facility.
Video Recording
Video record of May 13, 2025, and May 14, 2025, from 7pm to
9pm was reviewed by this consultant. The video recording is
within the main common area where Youth A and Youth B were both
located. Staff 5 was the primary staff supervising Youth A and Youth
B during the dates and time periods of the video review. There was
no touching viewed of Youth B to Youth A witnessed on the video.
Due to encryption and length of video, the videos could not be
uploaded to the case file.
Documents reviewed:
- Facility incident report number 3692 dated 05/14/2025-
This incident report was completed by Staff 4 and
consistent with her interview. The incident report notes
Youth A had called her worker and then called the police
right after stating that she does not feel safe at the facility.
Law Enforcement did talk with Youth A and Therapist.
- Email from Administrator 1 dated 05/28/2025-
Administrator 1 noted neither Youth A or Youth B were on
one-to-one supervision on May 13, 2025, or May 14, 2025.
Administrator 1 confirmed Staff 5 was the staff supervising
Youth A and Youth B on May 13, 2025 and May 14, 2025
from 7pm-9pm.
- Facility Supervision Policy with most recent review
date of March 2021- This policy notes that youth on all
units are to be continually supervised. Staff are responsible
for client supervision and should maintain line of sight
management of those clients at all times.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Youth A refused to talk about
the allegations with this consultant and Youth B denied ever
touching Youth A. Staff 5 was interviewed and reported no
concerns of any touching occurring and reported he followed
supervision protocol. Video footage was reviewed and there was
5

no touching viewed within the footage for the alleged dates and
times.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
